class OCT(oct_params, data, results_folder)[source]

Bases: CDHPOBase

results

List to store the results of the OCT procedure.

mb_configs

List to store the configurations for Markov boundary identification.

pred_configs

List to store the configurations for predictive modeling.

mu_configs

List to store the configurations for measuring the predictive performance.

mb_size

Numpy array to store the size of the Markov boundary for each node.

total_configs_run

Total number of configurations run during the OCT procedure.

configs_ran

List of configurations that have been run during the OCT procedure.

Matrix array of the mec graph of the best configuration

Matrix array of the graph of the best configuration

var_map

Var map array of the best configuration

Class member to store the parameters required for the OCT procedure.

data

Data to be used for the OCT procedure.

n_samples

Number of samples and nodes in the data.

Number of samples and nodes in the data.

save_progress()[source]

Save the progress of the OCT to a file.

Parameters: path (str): The file path to save the progress to.

load_progress(path)[source]

Load the progress of the OCT from a file.

Parameters: path (str): The file path to load the progress from.

fold_fit(target, c, mec_graphs_configs, train_indexes, test_indexes, fold)[source]

A function that performs Markov boundary identification and predictive modeling for a single fold of a target in a particular configuration.

Parameters:

  • target (int) – Target index.

  • c (int) – Configuration index.

  • mec_graphs_configs (list of numpy arrays) – MEC graphs configurations.

  • data_train (pandas DataFrame) – Training data.

  • data_test (pandas DataFrame) – Testing data.

  • fold (int) – Fold index.

Returns:

Markov boundary. prediction (numpy array): Predicted values. y_test (numpy array): Actual target values for the test data.

Return type:

mb (numpy array)

y_test_folds_all = []
nodes_parallel(target, c, mec_graphs_configs, train_indexes, test_indexes)[source]

Calculate the mutual information between the true values and predicted values of a target node in a parallel manner

Parameters: target (int): target node id c (int): regularization parameter mec_graphs_configs (list): list of mec graph configurations data_train (numpy array): training data data_test (numpy array): test data

Returns: mu (float): mutual information score between the true values and predicted values mb_folds (list): list of Markov blanket of each fold pred_folds (list): list of predictions for each fold y_test_folds (list): list of true values for each fold

config_parallel(c, mec_graphs_configs, train_indexes, test_indexes)[source]

Calculate the mutual information scores for all target nodes in a parallel manner

Parameters: c (int): regularization parameter mec_graphs_configs (list): list of mec graph configurations data_train (numpy array): training data data_test (numpy array): test data

Returns: mu (list): list of mutual information scores for each target node mb_folds (list): list of Markov blanket of each fold for each target node pred_folds (list): list of predictions for each fold for each target node y_test_folds (list): list of true values for each fold for each target node

permutations(node, poolYhat_best, poolYhat_cur, idxs, poolY, i)[source]

Calculate the mutual information score after swapping two predictions

Parameters: node (int): node id poolYhat_best (np.array): array of predictions of best configuration poolYhat_cur (np.array): array of predictions of current configuration idxs (list): list of indexes for permutation poolY (np.array): ground truth target variable i (int): index for the current iteration in the permutation

Returns: [x,y] (list): mutual information scores of the best and current configurations after the swap

permutations_nodes(node, c)[source]

Parallel calculation of mutual information score after swapping predictions of different configurations

Parameters: node (int): node id c (int): configuration id

Returns: [results[:, 0], results[:, 1]] (list): mutual information scores of the best and current configurations after the swap

calculate_pvalues(c)[source]

Parallel calculation of mutual information score after swapping predictions of different configurations

Parameters: c (int): configuration id

Returns: [results[:, 0], results[:, 1]] (list): mutual information scores of the best and current configurations after the swap

run()[source]

Runs the hyperparameter optimization process. This method should be overridden by subclasses to provide the specific optimization algorithm.

Returns:

The optimal configuration.

run_new()[source]

Re-runs the optimization process, typically with new or updated configurations.

find_best_config(algorithms)[source]

Finds the best configuration among the given algorithms.

Parameters:

algorithms – A list of algorithms to consider.

Returns:

The best configuration.
